alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Marshall; Tate (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:21PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern DeSoto, southwestern Marshall and northeastern Tate Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 421 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Independence, or 9 miles southeast of Hernando, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coldwater, Byhalia, Barr, Independence, Red Banks, Wakefield, Lurline, Alphaba, Victoria, Cockrum, Aiken, Wyatte, Tyro, Watson, Chulahoma, New Garden, Thyatira, Poagville, Bett and Rockhill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Mississippi.
